title: Fund raises $25G for slain NYPD officer
text:

Previous Next Enlarge A day after Officer Randolph Holder’s murder, his devastated family is already getting support they need, thanks to a former Mets player and others who have “answered the call.”
DCPI NYPD Officer Randolph Holder was shot and killed in East Harlem Tuesday evening. The New York Police and Fire Widows’ and Children’s Benefit Fund, Answer the Call, has already cut a $25,000 check for Holder’s family, something the organization has been doing for the past 30 years.
“These first responders lay down their lives for us, the least we can do is take care of their families,” said former New York Mets outfielder Rusty Staub, who created the fund in 1985.
Donations can be made by going to answerthecall.org/get-involved/donate .
